QAPair.Question: What is (are) Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury - aftercare ?
QAPair.Answer: A ligament is a band of tissue that connects a bone to another bone. The anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) is located inside your knee joint and connects the bones of your upper and lower leg. An ACL injury occurs when the ligament is stretched or torn. A partial ACL tear occurs when only part of the ligament is torn. A complete ACL tear occurs when the entire ligament is torn into two pieces or detaches from the bone.
